item.title: 高盛失去亚洲宏观部高级销售主管 Mats Dewitte
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，帮助高盛集团负责亚洲大部分地区宏观销售的马茨-德威特（Mats Dewitte）已经辞职，他在这家美国银行工作了近二十年。【原文：Mats Dewitte, who helps run macro sales at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. for most of Asia, has resigned after almost two decades with the US bank, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 参加切尔滕纳姆赛马节的马匹面临英国脱欧的新障碍
item.description:
运输公司面临更多繁文缛节，以确保马匹能够在本周举行的 500 万英镑抽奖活动中奔跑。【原文：

Transport firms face more red tape to ensure horses can run at the £5 million sweepstakes this week.

】

item.title: 谷歌亿万富豪家族办公室聘请 GIC 校友负责绿色交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，谷歌联合创始人谢尔盖-布林（Sergey Brin）的家族办公室已聘请新加坡主权财富基金可持续发展部前主管帮助寻找和管理绿色投资。【原文：The family office of Google co-founder Sergey Brin has hired the former head of sustainability for Singapore’s sovereign wealth fund to help find and manage green investments, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国库存持续增加，铁矿石困境加剧
item.description: 铁矿石暴跌近 5%，跌向每吨 110 美元的关口，原因是中国的需求令人失望，导致市场库存过剩。【原文：Iron ore slumped almost 5% — heading toward the $110 a ton mark — as disappointing demand in China left the market lumbered with bulging inventories.】

item.title: 中国太阳能股票上涨，押注安装限制将放宽
item.description: 由于市场猜测中国政府将放宽对可再生能源安装的上限，从而改善该行业的前景，中国太阳能股延续了近期的涨势。【原文：Chinese solar shares extended their recent gains amid speculation the government will relax caps on renewable installation, improving the outlook for the sector.】

item.title: 世界负利率实验在日本接近尾声
item.description: 人们普遍预计，日本央行将在未来几周内取消全球最后一个负利率，这标志着全球央行非正统政策大实验的收官之作。【原文：The Bank of Japan is widely expected to scrap the world’s last negative interest rate in the coming weeks, marking the closing act of global central banks’ grand experiment with unorthodox policies.】

item.title: 马来西亚财富基金的资产和利润在经济复苏中大幅增长
item.description: 由于市场环境改善，马来西亚国有有限公司（Khazanah Nasional Bhd.【原文：Khazanah Nasional Bhd. saw its net asset value rebound by about 4% in 2023, as its profits tripled from a year ago on improving market conditions.】

item.title: IndiGo 创始人拉克什-甘瓦尔（Rakesh Gangwal）欲以 7.95 亿美元的价格出售股票
item.description: 印度最大的航空公司 IndiGo 的联合创始人正寻求通过出售股票筹集高达 7.95 亿美元的资金，这将是印度自 2019 年以来最大的一次大宗出售。【原文：A co-founder of IndiGo, India’s biggest airline, is seeking to raise up to $795 million from selling his stock, which would be the largest block sale in the country since 2019.】

item.title: 日元升值拖累出口商，日经指数创一年来最大跌幅
item.description: 日经 225 日经平均指数创下 2022 年 10 月以来的最大跌幅，原因是越来越多的人猜测日本央行将加息，这推高了日元并打击了出口股。科技股下跌，追随美国同行走低，原因是投资者从过去一年表现最好的一些股票中获利了结。【原文：The Nikkei 225 Stock Average fell the most since October 2022 as growing speculation the Bank of Japan will raise interest rates boosted the yen and hurt exporter shares. Tech shares slumped, following US peers lower, as investors took profit from some of the top performers over the past year.】

item.title: 巴克莱称，在债券 "过度 "上涨后抛售美国国债
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）认为，投资者应考虑抛售 10 年期国债，因为全球最大经济体的韧性使近期美国债券的涨势显得过度。【原文：Investors should consider selling 10-year Treasuries as the resilience of the world’s largest economy makes the recent US bond rally look overdone, according to Barclays Plc.】

item.title: 高盛调整亚洲融资领导层，韩国区主管将离职
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc）正在对其亚太地区（日本除外）融资部门的高层进行调整，并对其在韩国的领导层进行重组，这是该银行在全球范围内更广泛变革的一部分。【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc is reshuffling the top ranks of its Asia Pacific ex-Japan financing group and rejigging its leadership in Korea, as part of broader changes within the bank globally.】

item.title: 中国大型政策会议难以激发大宗商品多头热情
item.description: 中国今年最受瞩目的政治事件没有给希望刺激世界最大原材料市场需求的大宗商品多头带来多少欢呼。【原文：China’s highest profile political event of the year provided little cheer for commodities bulls hoping for a jolt to demand in the world’s biggest market for raw materials.】

item.title: 基金经理在错误的时间做空澳元，创下历史新高
item.description: 就在澳元回升之际，基金经理们增加了澳元空头头寸，这似乎是踏入了熊市陷阱。【原文：Fund managers look to have stepped into a bear trap by increasing short positions on the Australian dollar just as the currency staged a recovery.】

item.title: 香港市场监管机构建议中国降低 "股票通 "门槛
item.description: 香港最高市场监管机构建议中国降低投资者参与与香港股票交易挂钩的门槛，以提高流动性和交易量。【原文：Hong Kong’s top market regulator proposed that China lower the threshold for investors to take part in the stock trading link with the city as a way of boosting liquidity and trading.】

item.title: 监察机构称银行家向韩国退休人员误导了与中国挂钩的高风险票据
item.description: 韩国金融监督机构称，它发现韩国一些最大的经纪商向散户投资者（其中许多是退休人员）虚假陈述了一系列与中国挂钩的高风险结构性产品。【原文：South Korea’s financial watchdog said it found a range of instances where some of the country’s largest brokers misrepresented risky China-linked structured products to retail investors, many of whom are retirees.】

item.description:
沪深 300 指数从三年跌势中反弹，但未能平息对经济蔓延的担忧

【原文：

Benchmark CSI 300 index rebounding from three years of declines fails to calm contagion fears

item.title: 英国公用事业公司增加污水溢出投资，但泰晤士河水务公司不在此列
item.description: 英国六家自来水公司将斥资总计 1.8 亿英镑（约合 2.31 亿美元）来减少数千次污水泄漏，但泰晤士水务有限公司（Thames Water Ltd. ）并不在其中，它是英国最大的自来水公司，也是最严重的违规者之一。【原文：Six English water companies will spend a total £180 million ($231 million) to cut thousands of sewage spills, but Thames Water Ltd., the largest and one of the worst offenders, isn’t one of them.】

item.title: 日本摆脱衰退促使日本央行接近加息
item.description: 在企业强劲支出的帮助下，日本经济在去年年底避免了陷入衰退，这一结果改善了央行考虑自 2007 年以来首次加息时机的前景。【原文：Japan’s economy avoided falling into a recession at the end of last year, helped by robust spending by businesses, an outcome that improves the optics for the central bank as it mulls the timing of its first interest rate hike since 2007.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 中国居民消费价格自 8 月份以来首次出现上涨。印度与欧洲四国签署自由贸易协定。两名飞行员在驾驶舱睡着后被停职。以下是您今天需要了解的信息。【原文：China’s consumer prices rose for the first time since August. India and four European countries sign free trade pact. Two pilots suspended after both fell asleep in the cockpit. Here’s what you need to know today.】

item.title: 投资者期待美国通胀数据公布，石油止跌回升
item.description: 本周美国将公布通胀数据，欧佩克和国际能源署的报告也可能为需求前景提供线索。【原文：Oil held a loss ahead of US inflation data and reports from OPEC and the IEA this week that may provide clues on the demand outlook.】

item.title: 苹果、汇丰与全球部长共同出席伦敦反欺诈峰会
item.description: 来自 11 个国家的政府部长将与银行家和技术高管一起参加本周在伦敦举行的国际反欺诈峰会。【原文：Government ministers from 11 countries will be joined by bankers and technology executives at an international summit to fight against fraud taking place in London this week.】

item.title: 美国CPI成为焦点，亚洲股市将下跌：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市周一开盘表现平淡，因为投资者期待周二公布的美国通胀数据，预计该数据将显示核心物价进一步放缓。【原文：Shares in Asia were primed for a muted open Monday as investors look ahead to US inflation data due Tuesday that is expected to show a further slowing in core prices.】

item.title: 印尼盾在美联储反弹前面临季节性疲软
item.description: 随着全球投资者开始抢购印尼的债券，印尼盾可能会在短期内走软，然后再获得支撑。【原文：Indonesia’s rupiah may be set for near-term weakness before gaining traction as global investors start to snap up the nation’s bonds.】

item.title: 本周全球商品市场值得关注的五大图表
item.description: 在日本纪念导致福岛核灾难的大地震和海啸发生 13 周年之际，日本的原子能正在重新崛起。黄金价格一路飙升，创下历史新高。与此同时，Archer-Daniels-Midland 公司将发布因会计调查而推迟发布的第四季度财报。石油勘探者、投资者和分析师将齐聚 S&P Global 的 CERAWeek 会议，这是石油行业最大的全球活动之一。【原文：Japan is seeing a resurgence of atomic power as the country marks the 13th anniversary of the massive earthquake and tsunami that led to the Fukushima nuclear disaster. Gold is on fire, soaring to a fresh record. Meanwhile, Archer-Daniels-Midland Co. is slated to release its fourth-quarter results, which have been delayed amid an accounting probe. Oil explorers, investors and analysts will gather at the CERAWeek by S&P Global conference, one of the industry’s biggest global events.】

item.title: 德国面临铁路和航空员工罢工引发的更多旅行混乱
item.description: 在代表德国汉莎航空公司（Deutsche Lufthansa AG）机舱乘务员和火车司机的工会宣布举行更多罢工之后，德国准备迎接新一轮旅行中断浪潮。【原文：Germany braced for another wave of travel disruptions after unions representing Deutsche Lufthansa AG’s cabin crew and train drivers announced more walkouts, adding to a string of travel chaos that hit Europe’s largest economy over the past months.】

item.title: 日本回收新贵试水 SPAC 首次登陆纽交所
item.description: 日本一家小型塑料回收公司正准备本月通过 SPAC 合并的方式在美国上市，尽管许多有希望上市的公司都在推迟或取消此类计划。【原文：A small Japanese plastic recycling company is gearing up to go public in the US through a SPAC merger this month, even as many IPO hopefuls are delaying or scrapping such plans.】

item.title: Reddit 计划首次公开募股，最高筹资 7.48 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Reddit 公司及其投资者正在寻求在今年迄今为止规模最大的首次公开募股中筹集高达 7.48 亿美元的资金。【原文：Reddit Inc. and its investors are seeking to raise as much as $748 million in what would be one of the biggest initial public offerings so far this year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 债券交易员关注关键的美国通胀报告以确定下一步赌注
item.description: 本周，美国债券市场将迎来自己的 "超级星期二"：美国将公布新的通胀数据，投资者将据此预测美联储何时开始降息。【原文：This week, the US bond market faces its own Super Tuesday of sorts: the release of fresh inflation data investors will use to predict when the Federal Reserve will start cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 美国敦促 UnitedHealth 在黑客攻击后向医疗服务提供者支付费用
item.description: 拜登政府正在要求联合健康集团公司加快向医疗服务提供商付款，因为最近的一次网络攻击导致其子公司 Change Healthcare 的业务中断数周。【原文：The Biden Administration is asking UnitedHealth Group Inc. to expedite payments to health care providers after a recent cyberattack caused weeks of disruptions to its subsidiary, Change Healthcare.】
